result.execSummary:
The defendant Peggy J Kaczmarek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Peggy J Kaczmarek is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Peggy J Kaczmarek was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not to drive any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license
Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay a fine of $600.00 plus costs, including the DNA surcharge over the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION.
- Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
- Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Release privileges for employment and AODA treatment purposes only. Good Time credit.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peggy J Kaczmarek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA AND SENTENCING Transcript (31 pages) commencing 11/3/14 received and filed.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: The defendant's motion or request for additional release privileges is DENIED.  Additional release privileges would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless and frustrate the court's specific sentencing intent - signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request to attend a 500 hour pilates course.

Defendant Peggy J Kaczmarek in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for  3 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS. 
Credit given for 4 days time served if revoked.

Court finds the defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 11 MONTHS "condition time" at the House of Correction with release privileges for employment and AODA treatment purposes only.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY FINE in the amount of $600.00 plus costs - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered defendant's driver operating privileges REVOKED for a period of 24 months.
* Defendant is not to drive any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
* Any vehicle titled in the defenandant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for a period of 24 months.
* Court ordered GOOD TIME credit.
* The conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program.
(2) Defendant's Character Witness Letters.

Defendant Peggy J Kaczmarek in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #2 dismissed outright.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Parties not ready to proceed with a Plea Hearing today.

Defendant Peggy J Kaczmarek in court with attorney Thomas J Flanagan.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug test and portable breathalyzers. IF THEY FAIL TO REPORT TO WCS A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-08-2014 at 08:30 am.
